data.title: Sam Altman named Time Magazine's 2023 CEO of The Year; Bill Gates feels privileged to watch OpenAI boss 'unlock a new era of AI'
data.meta_description: 2023 saw Altman emerge as one of the most powerful tech executives in the world, at the forefront of a revolution.
data.text:
Story outline

OpenAI's Sam Altman has been named Time Magazine's "CEO of the Year" for 2023

The CEO stated that 2023 marked a turning point for artificial intelligence

OpenAI grew into an $80-billion entity under Altman's leadership

Altman envisions building superintelligence as a society-wide project

Bill Gates praised Altman on LinkedIn, recognizing him as a leader inspiring new CEOs

This year, truly, has belonged to Sam Altman. The OpenAI founder on Wednesday was chosen by Time Magazine as "CEO of the year."

Time, in its feature on Altman wrote that the impact of ChatGPT and its successor, GPT-4, was transformative—for the company and the world.

“For many people, 2023 was the year that they started taking AI seriously,” Altman is quoted as saying in an interview to Time on November 30.

Sam Altman on the cover of Time Magazine.

OpenAI, which was conceived as a nonprofit research lab dedicated to building artificial intelligence for humanity, headed to become an $80-billion entity. The year saw Altman transform into one of the most powerful and venerated executives in the world, leading discussions on tech and its superfast evolution.

"Building superintelligence is going to be a society-wide project," Altman told Time. "We would like to be one of the shapers, but it’s not going to be something that one company just does. It will be far bigger than any one company."

Tech tycoon, Bill Gates, meanwhile gave a shout-out to Altman on LinkedIn. The Microsoft founder, while sharing a link to the Time feature, wrote that the OpenAI founder is at the forefront of the AI revolution and is inpsiring new business leaders.

Bill Gates's LinkedIn post for Sam Altman.

"Sam is leading a new generation of inspiring CEOs. It’s been a privilege to watch him unlock a new era of AI," Gates wrote in his post on the professional networking platform.

ChatGPT - a large language model developed by OpenAI - turned a year old on November 30. Since its launch a year ago, ChatGPT has gone on to upend the world of tech, causing a major disruption. Today it has become the fastest app to cross 100 million users.

Altman, the CEO of OpenAI made much news in November thanks to all the corporate shenanigans being played out over his ouster and subsequent reinstatement at the company.

Also known as Chat Generative Pre-Trained Transformer, ChatGPT was created on GPT - 3.5, a language model developed by OpenAI. The early model of ChatGPT was exclusively used for research purposes.

The chatbot became a global phenomenon as it cracked several competitive examinations. It went viral after it passed Wharton School MBA exams, law tests at the University of Minnesota, American Medical licensing exams with flying colours! However, the bot also hit headlines for the wrong reasons as it presented incorrect information as accurate facts.
